page.title: 03BUILDINGS IN PLYMTREE
page.content: Plymtree is a small village with about one hundred buildings ranging from cob houses to new estates. It is in the shape of a triangle. As you enter the village from the East there is the Victorian School House and School. Opposite the School there is the first Estate which is of bungalows. As you go further down the road you come to the centre of the village where there is the second estate of detached houses still under construction. This estate is situated between the older cob buildings that follow the road to the Public House, Shop and Church. Further in-filling of new detached properties forms a prominent feature of the heart of the village. To the NNE is ribbon development of newish houses, a council estate of 12 semi detached houses and the Chapel.
